title: 20 Things Only Adults Noticed In Animated Movies

media:group.media:title: 20 Things Only Adults Noticed In Animated Movies
media:group.media:description:
NOT JUST FOR KIDS?

You know how it is. You’re a writer or an animator at Pixar, Dreamworks, Disney, ILM, Blue Sky, Weta, Warner Bros, Nickelodeon, Sony, Nippon or any other major animated studio. You’ve been toiling away on your new Toy Story, the next Spirited Away, a future Minions sequel, or the latest Shrek adventure. And someone decides, why not sneak a few adult references into these animated movies? A dirty joke, maybe, or some dark subtext? A double entendre or innuendo? A visual detail that no child would pick up on, though a more mature viewer might pause and say, wait a minute!

From the days of Snow White and the Seven Dwarves, through Pinocchio, The Jungle Book, Dark Crystal, The Black Cauldron, The Little Mermaid, The Lion King, Despicable Me, Big Hero 6, Frozen Elsa singalongs and whatever other CGI or hand-drawn cartoon is currently giving young theatre goers joy around the world, the staff behind the scenes have been finding ways to make their movies work on multiple levels. And now, we at Screenrant - or Screen Rant, if you like - are here to gather together every cute, grim and / or bawdy reference we could find - or at least, 20 of them - in one handy video, not in chronological order, well, sort of. Vaguely structured in the order that the adventures of Woody and Buzz Lightyear came out. But it does leap around a bit. So don’t worry about continuity, is what we’re saying.

OK? OK. To infinity and beyond!
